newsitem.title: USA: ValuJet sees 1999 delivery of MD-95 jets.
newsitem.headline: ValuJet sees 1999 delivery of MD-95 jets.

text.p: ValuJet Inc said Wednesday it expects to begin taking delivery during the last half of 1999 of 50 MD-95 aircraft the company is ordering from McDonnell Douglas Corp.
"All the indications we have is that it is on time," ValuJet president D. Joseph Corr said at the annual shareholders' meeting."

"They're talking about being behind their schedule in terms of days, a couple of weeks," Corr said. "We're anxiously looking forward to the first deliveries which are scheduled to begin in the second half of 1999."

ValuJet announced in October 1995 that it had reached an agreement with the aircraft manufacturer ordering 50 of the new 100-seat airliners, seen as succeeding the DC-9. The order was valued at more than $1 billion.
